flashcards.title: Flashcard 1
flashcards.question: Source Code
flashcards.answer: The human-readable set of instructions written in a programming language that a programmer writes. It needs to be compiled or interpreted into machine code for a computer to execute.

flashcards.title: Flashcard 2
flashcards.question: Program
flashcards.answer: A set of instructions written in a programming language that performs a specific task when executed by a computer.

flashcards.title: Flashcard 3
flashcards.question: Programming
flashcards.answer: The process of designing, writing, testing, debugging, and maintaining the source code of computer programs.

flashcards.title: Flashcard 4
flashcards.question: Command
flashcards.answer: An instruction given by a user or a program to a computer to perform a specific task.

flashcards.title: Flashcard 5
flashcards.question: Command Execution
flashcards.answer: The process of performing an instruction or a set of instructions by the computer to solve a given programming designated task.

flashcards.title: Flashcard 6
flashcards.question: Operators
flashcards.answer: A symbol performing operations on operands.

flashcards.title: Flashcard 7
flashcards.question: Data Type
flashcards.answer: Refers to the classification of data such as 'integers', 'strings', 'lists', 'tuples', and 'dictionaries'.

flashcards.title: Flashcard 8
flashcards.question: Integers
flashcards.answer: A Python data type that represents whole numbers, both positive and negative, without decimals.

flashcards.title: Flashcard 9
flashcards.question: Floating-points (floats)
flashcards.answer: A data type used to represent real numbers, including decimal points.

flashcards.title: Flashcard 10
flashcards.question: Boolean value
flashcards.answer: An object representing a True or a False value in a logical expression.
